meta.description: Family members, common foods, everyday objects, and telling time in French.

module.name: Daily Life
module.description: Learn vocabulary for family, food, everyday objects, and time expressions.

lessons.title: Family and Daily Words
lessons.description: Learn essential vocabulary for family members, common foods, and household items.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'mother' in French?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Mère' is mother. 'Maman' is mom (informal).

quiz_questions.question: What does 'frère' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Frère' means brother. 'Sœur' is sister.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'water' in French?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Eau' means water. It's feminine: l'eau.

quiz_questions.question: What is 'pain' in English?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Pain' means bread in French.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'table' in French?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Table' is the same in French! It's feminine: la table.

lessons.title: Possessives and Avoir/Être
lessons.description: Learn possessive adjectives and master avoir (to have) and être (to be).

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'my mother' in French?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Ma' is used for feminine nouns: ma mère.

quiz_questions.question: 'J'ai deux frères' means:
quiz_questions.explanation: 'J'ai' = I have (avoir). 'Deux frères' = two brothers.

quiz_questions.question: Which is correct for 'my friend' (female)?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Mon amie' - use 'mon' before feminine nouns starting with a vowel.

quiz_questions.question: Complete: 'Nous ___ français' (We are French)
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Sommes' is the nous form of être (to be).

quiz_questions.question: Complete: 'Ils ___ faim' (They are hungry)
quiz_questions.explanation: In French, you 'have' hunger: 'avoir faim'. Ils ont faim.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'our house'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Notre' means 'our' for both masculine and feminine singular nouns.

quiz_questions.question: 'Elle est médecin' means:
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Est' (être) + profession in French (no article needed).

quiz_questions.question: Which expression uses 'avoir' (to have)?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'J'ai faim' (I have hunger) - French uses 'avoir' for hunger, thirst, age.

lessons.title: Family Conversations
lessons.description: Practice talking about your family and daily routines.

flashcards.back: Tu as des frères et sœurs?

quiz_questions.question: How do you ask 'Do you have siblings?' informally?
options: Tu as des frères et sœurs?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Tu as des frères et sœurs?' uses 'avoir' (to have).

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'I live with my family'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'J'habite avec ma famille' - 'habiter' means to live.

quiz_questions.question: What does 'Quelle heure est-il?' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Quelle heure est-il?' asks for the time.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'It's 3 o'clock'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Il est trois heures' - always include 'heures' (hours).

quiz_questions.question: How do you respond to 'Combien de frères as-tu?'
quiz_questions.explanation: 'J'ai trois frères' answers how many brothers you have.

lessons.title: Reading About Daily Life
lessons.description: Read and understand texts about family and daily routines.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Ma famille est grande. J'ai trois frères.' How many brothers?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Trois frères' means three brothers.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Je prends le petit-déjeuner à huit heures.' When does the person eat breakfast?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'À huit heures' means at eight o'clock.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Ma mère cuisine tous les jours.' What does the mother do?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Cuisine' means 'she cooks'. 'Cuisiner' = to cook.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Nous habitons dans une petite maison mais elle est confortable.' The house is:
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Petite mais confortable' = small but comfortable.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Le dimanche, nous déjeunons avec les grands-parents.' When do they lunch with grandparents?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Le dimanche' means on Sunday/Sundays.

lessons.title: Days and Time Expressions
lessons.description: Learn to understand days of the week and time expressions.

quiz_questions.question: Which day sounds like 'luhn-DEE'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Lundi' (Monday) is pronounced 'luhn-DEE'.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'Saturday' in French?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Samedi' is Saturday. 'Dimanche' is Sunday.

quiz_questions.question: French days of the week are:
quiz_questions.explanation: Unlike English, French days are not capitalized.

quiz_questions.question: What does 'le week-end' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Le week-end' is borrowed from English and means the weekend.

quiz_questions.question: Which day sounds like 'mehr-kruh-DEE'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Mercredi' (Wednesday) is pronounced 'mehr-kruh-DEE'.
